intro: Diplolegnon riceanum, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its striking, yellowish inflorescence that resembles a star. The plant produces small, green to yellowish flowers arranged in a spadix, which is enclosed by a modified leaf called a spathe. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in some regions.
